abstract.p: Letter from John J Donnellan Jr (Department of Veterans Affairs) comments on July 5 article on ailing and lonely veterans at Brooklyn veterans hospital during Fourth of July celebration

block.p: You showed the poignant reality of some hospitalized veterans at the Brooklyn veterans hospital during the Fourth of July celebration (''In a U.S. Hospital, Lonely Ex-Soldiers Get No Bands and Few Visitors,'' news article, July 5).

You showed the poignant reality of some hospitalized veterans at the Brooklyn veterans hospital during the Fourth of July celebration (''In a U.S. Hospital, Lonely Ex-Soldiers Get No Bands and Few Visitors,'' news article, July 5).

Still, many committed health care staff members spent the day providing them with compassionate care. Veterans fight disease in modern rooms with outstanding views. This is the reality of the V.A. Medical Center, which is dedicated to caring for those who provide us with cause to celebrate Independence Day.
JOHN J. DONNELLAN JR. Dir., Dept. of Veterans Affairs New York Harbor Healthcare System Brooklyn, July 12, 2000
